DataElement.preferredName: Patient Creatinine Clearance Exclusion Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to patient's exclusion criteria based on the measurement of the clearance of endogenous creatinine, used for evaluating the glomerular filtration rate.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to patient's exclusion criteria based on the measurement of the clearance of endogenous creatinine, used for evaluating the glomerular filtration rate.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Measurement of the clearance of endogenous creatinine, used for evaluating the glomerular filtration rate.:Exclusion; the act of restricting entrance or barring from participation.

Concepts.definition: The determination of the clearance of endogenous creatinine, used for evaluating the glomerular filtration rate.
Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Creatinine < 1.5x institutional upper limits of normal OR Creatinine clearance >=60 mL/min for patients with creatinine levels >=1.5x institutional upper limit of normal.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Measured or calculated creatinine clearance >=60 mL/min for patients with creatinine levels >1.5 x ULN

ReferenceDocuments.name: ALT - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is Calculated Creatinine Clearance obtained within 2 weeks of registration and calculated CrCl greater than or equal to 45 ml/min using the Cockcroft and Gault formula or the measured glomerular filtration rate (GFR) using the appropriate radiolabeled method (51-CrEDTA or Tc99m-DTPA) to calculate CrCl?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is GFR greater than or equal to 50mL/min/1.73m^2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the estimated creatinine clearance (CCr) greater than or equal to 30 ml/min?

DataElement.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form
DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Eligibility Ind-2 2018257v1 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
